metadata.title: CVE-2021-33120 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Out of bounds read under complex microarchitectural condition in memory subsystem for some Intel Atom(R) Processors may allow authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure or cause denial of service via network access. Brandon Miller discovered that some Intel processors did not properly restrict access in some situations. This may allow a local authenticated user to obtain sensitive information or allow a remote user to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-33120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
